description.narrative: Primary schools are safe and have capacity to provide foundational skills-literacy, numeracy, life-skills in line with national standards, using innovative approaches & fully implement efficiency (reduce repetition, increase retention and transition) support reintegration policies, which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-aged girls and boys, especially early adolescents (aged 10-14) [in targeted districts], acquire essential learning outcomes and practice skills for life, are safe from exploitation, harmful practices and violence, and benefit from integrated social services (including in emergencies).

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF EDUCATION SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Primary schools are safe and have capacity to provide foundational skills-literacy, numeracy, life-skills in line with national standards, using innovative approaches & fully implement efficiency (reduce repetition, increase retention and transition); support reintegration policies

description.narrative: $12.5M of additional funding from key education sector partners was leveraged through the Education Sector Joint Fund (ESJF) to support the Malawi Education Sector Improvement Project. Key gaps in education delivery in Malawi were identified through the Education Sector Analysis which informed process of development of new Education Sector plan. A total of 87,565 learners affected by Cyclone Idai induced floods continued with their education due to timely UNICEF humanitarian assistance with emergency supplies (813 school in a box kits, 227 kits of extra materials and 794 recreation kits). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/12/2019
